MapAndAttrs: 23924 N James Madison Hwy 2016 Toyota Tundra SR/SR5 VIN: 5TFCY5F14GX020305 condition: excellent cylinders: 8 cylinders drive: 4wd fuel: gas odometer: 38,011 paint color: white title status: clean transmission: automatic type: pickup more ads by this seller
PostingBody: Double Cab, Long Bed, 4x4, only 38k miles!!!!! Wow!!! What an awesome low miles Tundra SR that is clean, clean, clean. This 1/2 ton 5.7 V8 Tundra muscles out the big three - Dodge Ford and Chevy- by offering four front-hinged doors coupled with an 8 foot bed. This Tundra represents a rare and desirable cab and bed length configuration for the 1/2 ton segment. So if four properly-swinging doors on your cab, 4x4, and 8 foot long-bed make up your 1/2 ton bucket list, this white Tundra is your Huckleberry. This two owner truck has averaged only 4000 miles a year since it was sold new in Alexandria Virginia. The Car-Fax shows no accidents and the paint and body have nary a mark anywhere. This truck will not disappoint. The Tundra SR is trimmed out with a clean, dark cloth interior that is tidy and simple. There is a back up camera and trailer brake control system for making good use of your hitch out back. The bed is lined with spray liner and the truck comes with rubber weather mats to keep things clean. This truck has a suggested retail of $31,000 thanks to its incredibly low mileage. Country Motors has it listed at $27,999 as a beat the next snow storm price. Call Dave at 434-983-1656. Country Corner is a Virginia dealer with a $499 processing fee. Please see the attached you-tube video links to look at the super clean chassis, hear the engine run, and demo the 4x4. The wind shield fluid dispenser does not work as well and has not worked since I have owned the vehicle. No other issues with the vehicle to note. Due to the above mentioned that needs to be fixed I am willing to negotiate the offers. 25k OBO Title is in hand.

While this isn't a possibility in every situation, it is often an option when transacting with an Autonation dealership. Do you take trade-ins? Yes. We need to buy cars from customers every day because of the huge demand in the used vehicle market. It isn't necessary for you to buy a vehicle either. We'd love to purchase your vehicle regardless of age or mileage in most cases. What if I want to trade in my vehicle but still owe more than it's worth. This is another very common situation that usually won't prevent you from trading your vehicle and taking delivery of your next New or PreOwned vehicle. Are you guys really 1price? Imagine going to a dealership and telling them "don't tell me your best price, instead, keep going back and forth to your manager and waste as much of my time as possible, until we finally find your best price, and then try to guilt me into buying because you spent so much time with me".
